metadata.title: CVE-2024-3854 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In some code patterns the JIT incorrectly optimized switch statements andgenerated code with out-of-bounds-reads. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '125.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
